info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 3:42AM PST until December 28 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. Snow levels will fall to 5500 feet by 7 AM Tuesday, then continue to fall to 3000 feet by the end of Tuesday evening with snow continuing into Wednesday morning. * WHERE...Southern Oregon Cascades from highway 140 north. * WHEN...From 7 AM Tuesday to 7 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest accumulations are expected at elevations above 5000 feet, including the vicinities of Willamette Pass, Diamond Lake, Crater Lake, and Lake of the Woods. Snowfall rates of 1"/hr are have a 70% chance of occuring around Diamond Lake and Willamette Pass. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for the latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
